body.p:
To His Excellency
Beriah Magoffin
Gov. of Kentucky
Your Petitioners, William Shelton and El. W. Jones would most respectfully state that at the April Term 1860 they were fined $20 Each for being engaged in a game of cards --

They state that it is true they were guilty. that they got into a game simply for amusement a small amount was bet to pay for cigars a little whiskey and the cards -- not intended to violate Law, we were indicted and fined for the same -- we are poor men, times are hard, and no money in the mountains & -- we will be glad if you will relieve us from the fine -- We promise that you shall not in the future be troubled by us for a like favour

With great respect
We are your obt. Servts.
Wm Shelton
El. W. Jones
The undersigned citizens of Clay County would most respectfully ask a remission of the fines agst the Petitioners -- Wm Shelton and El. W. Jones
